meanings.definition: Mix (ingredients) together too much or for too long.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally overmix the cake batter, and now it's too dense.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to overmix the paint colors, or they will turn muddy.
meanings.sent3: When I overmix the salad dressing, it becomes a strange, unappetizing color.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overmix her schedule, leaving no time for relaxation.
meanings.sent5: The DJ overmixes the songs, creating a chaotic and confusing dance floor.

meanings.definition: To blend or combine ingredients excessively.
meanings.sent1: It's easy to overmix the pancake batter, resulting in tough pancakes.
meanings.sent2: Some chefs believe it's better to undermix than to overmix when making dough.
meanings.sent3: He always manages to overmix his smoothies, turning them into a frothy mess.
meanings.sent4: The artist tends to overmix the colors on his palette, creating a muddy mess.
meanings.sent5: She accidentally overmixes the fragrances, creating a strange and overpowering scent.
